III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement.
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On an unknown date, a staff washed their hands in water and
flicked the water onto youth’s clothed buttocks in a flirting manner.
Staff proceeded to tell youth that youth "looks good'. Staff did not
say or do anything else afterwards. It is unknown if the facility is
aware of the situation as youth has not shared this with the facility.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on August 31,
2023, and reported they had no further information.
Complainant stated she has not heard any concerns in the past
from Youth A regarding Supervisor 2.
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
31, 2023, and stated Youth A asked to speak to her and
Supervisor 1 the previous night about some concerns
regarding Supervisor 2. Director described Youth A stating
Supervisor 2 told Youth A she was “attractive” and when shaking
water off his hands in the kitchen, flinging the water off his hands
towards Youth A’s butt. Director stated Youth A told her there has
never been anything physical by Supervisor 2, only that
Supervisor 2 has said things to her, and it makes Youth A feel
uncomfortable. Director reported she asked Youth A to write
down her concerns and developed a safety plan which Youth A
signed. Director stated another safety plan was developed which
Supervisor 2 signed and Director spoke with staff members on
shift to ensure the safety plan would be followed. Director denied
any other youth or staff members expressing concern about
Supervisor 2. Director stated Youth A made these statements one
day after damaging Supervisor 2’s car by throwing a brick at the
windshield and scraping the sides of the car.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
31, 2023. Youth A stated Supervisor 2 has an “unprofessional
relationship with her.” Youth A denied Supervisor 2 ever touched
2

her physically. Youth A stated Staff 5, Supervisor 2’s girlfriend,
has an attitude towards her. Youth A reported she threw rocks at
Staff 5’s car and Staff 5 was telling the other youth in the house
that Youth A would have to pay for the damages. Youth A stated
she threw rocks as Staff 5’s car because Youth A was angry at
Supervisor 2 for flicking water at Youth A’s butt. Youth A
described being in the kitchen with Supervisor 2 while he was
doing dishes. Youth A stated Supervisor 2 walked past her and
flicked the water at Youth A’s butt. Youth A reported she wiped
the water off her legs three times and gave Supervisor 2 a dirty
look. Youth A denied Supervisor 2 said anything, Youth A stated
Supervisor 2 rolled his eyes at her and sighed. Youth A stated
she did not think any other youth or staff member was in the
kitchen when Supervisor 2 flicked water at Youth A’s bottom.
Youth A reported she could not recall the specifics of when
Supervisor 2 called her attractive, beautiful, and cute. Youth A
stated there were no other youth or staff members around when
Supervisor 2 made these comments. Youth A could not recall
when Supervisor 2 made these comments or how often the
comments have been made. Youth A stated she just feels
Supervisor 2 is “playing mind games with me.”
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
31, 2023. Youth B reported things were good at the facility and
staff are okay. Youth B stated she is “cool” with everyone and has
no concerns. Youth B denied hearing any staff member tell a
youth they were attractive, beautiful, or cute. Youth B denied
seeing any staff member make any inappropriate gestures or
action toward any youth.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
31, 2023. Youth C reported things were okay at the facility with
some youth leaving and two new youth moving in the previous
day. Youth C denied hearing any staff member tell a youth they
were attractive, beautiful, or cute. Youth C reported Youth A tells
other youth in the house Supervisor 2 is “attractive, hot and that
she would grab him.” Youth C stated Youth A makes
inappropriate comments to Supervisor 2 but has not heard
Supervisor 2 say anything back to Youth A. Youth C reported
Youth A smashed Staff 5’s (Supervisor 2’s girlfriend) car a couple
nights ago. Youth C denied seeing any staff member make any
inappropriate gesture or action toward any youth in the house.
Youth D and Youth E were interviewed face to face at the
facility on August 31, 2023, separately. They both stated they
have not heard any staff member tell a youth they were attractive,
3

beautiful, or cute. Youth D and Youth E denied having any
concerns with how staff talk to youth or act around youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
31, 2023, and via telephone on September 8, 2023. Staff 1
stated she was aware Staff 4 overheard Youth A tell a former
youth that Supervisor 2 was fine and that she was of age so it
should not matter. Staff 1 stated Staff 4 addressed the comments
with Youth A and the former youth and documented the
conversation on a case note. Staff 1 stated she has not heard
Youth A make any comments about Supervisor 2. Staff 1 denied
seeing or hearing Supervisor 2 tell any youth they were attractive,
beautiful, or cute. Staff 1 reported she did not have any concerns
with Supervisor 2. Staff 1 described while monitoring a phone call
between Youth A and an approved contact on Youth A’s phone
list, Youth A told this individual she smashed all the car windows
on Supervisor 2’s car and she was sad the investigation was
taking place because Supervisor 2 does not talk with Youth A
anymore. The individual on the phone told Youth A to talk with
Supervisor 2 and Youth A responded that Supervisor 2 is not
engaging with her and directing her to talk with other staff
members.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
August 31, 2023. Supervisor 2 reported working with Youth A
like the rest of the youth in the house. Supervisor 2 stated he
often must redirect Youth A for comments she makes and has
talked with staff to step in to say something and redirect Youth A
as well. Supervisor 2 described talking with Youth A in the past
about her life outside of the house. Supervisor 2 stated he told
Youth A something along the lines of, “your young, smart,
attractive, get out in the real world and make something of
yourself.” Supervisor 2 reported that was the only time he could
remember ever using the word attractive when talking with Youth
A. Supervisor 2 denied ever telling Youth A she was beautiful or
cute. Supervisor 2 stated there are times Youth A will refuse to
talk with other staff and only want to talk with him. Supervisor 2
reported sometimes he redirects Youth A to other staff and
sometimes he talks with Youth A. Supervisor 2 stated he does the
same with all the youth in the house. Supervisor 2 described
being in the kitchen, going back and forth between the sink and
cabinet, and he may have flicked water onto Youth A while she
was at the stove. Supervisor 2 stated he could not recall if he did
this or not but if it happened it was not on purpose. Supervisor 2
denied making any comments to Youth A while in the kitchen or
Youth A saying anything to him. Supervisor 2 stated he could not
4

recall Youth A ever hitting him on the bottom. Supervisor 2
reported if a youth does something like that they are redirected
and would lose a point. Supervisor 2 denied ever doing or saying
anything intentionally to Youth A to make her feel uncomfortable.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 6, 2023. Staff 2 denied having any concerns with
Supervisor 2’s interactions with any youth. Staff 2 reported Youth
A calls Supervisor 2 “favorite” and will say she is Supervisor 2’s
“favorite.” Staff 2 stated she has heard Supervisor 2 redirect
Youth A many times for saying these things. Staff 2 reported
Supervisor 2 has come to her asking for Staff 2 to redirect Youth A
or verbally engage with Youth A. Staff 2 denied ever seeing
Youth A hit Supervisor 2 on the bottom. Staff 2 denies having any
knowledge of Supervisor 2 flicking water at Youth A’s bottom.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 6, 2023. Staff 3 described Supervisor 2 as knowing
the rules, being strict and always knowing what is going on in the
house. Staff 3 stated she feels Supervisor 2 allows Youth A to
“walk all over him” and allows Youth A to do things that other
youth would not be allowed to do. Staff 3 reported Youth A is
allowed more snacks, goes to the refrigerator, and gets something
out without asking and has more phone calls than other youth.
Staff 3 stated these things Supervisor 2 would not allow other
youth in the house to do. Staff 3 stated she has not redirected
Youth A for doing these things, it would be the staff member the
youth is asking. Staff 3 denied seeing or hearing Supervisor 2 tell
any youth she was attractive, beautiful, or cute. Staff 3 reported
other youth in the home have come to her with concerns about
what Youth A is saying about Supervisor 2. Staff 3 stated youth
are saying Youth A will talk about how “handsome” Supervisor 2 is
or that she wants to get in Supervisor 2’s pants. Staff 3 reported
Youth A often will dress inappropriately when Supervisor 2 is
working and will have to be asked to change. Staff 3 stated
Supervisor 2 was talking to another staff member about getting his
dreads cut and Youth A told him he should not cut them because
he is so cute with the dreads. Staff 3 could not recall if Supervisor
2 or any staff member redirected Youth A. Staff 3 stated one night
before dinner Youth A hit Supervisor 2 on the bottom with a
notebook and he did not redirect Youth A, just walked out of the
kitchen. Staff 3 stated she did not redirect Youth A for the incident
and does not believe any other staff did either.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 6, 2023. Staff 4 described Supervisor 2 as a good
5

supervisor and that he knows his job. Staff 4 stated Supervisor 2
gets too comfortable with some youth (Youth A and Youth B), and
it could be looked at as a boundary issue. Staff 4 reported at
times Youth B will refuse to talk with any staff but Supervisor 2.
Staff 4 stated Supervisor 2 will tell Youth B there are other staff
here for you to talk to and will redirect Youth B to other staff but
when Youth A does the same thing, Supervisor 2 does not redirect
Youth A. Staff 4 denies ever hearing or seeing Supervisor 2 say
or do anything inappropriate with any youth. Staff 4 reported she
completed a case note a couple of weeks ago when Youth F, a
former youth, came to her, and stated Youth A was receiving
special treatment from Supervisor 2 and Youth A kept saying
Supervisor 2 was “fine” and that she could be with anyone she
wanted to. Staff 4 stated the Youth F also reported seeing Youth
A hit Supervisor 2 on the bottom. Staff 4 denied ever seeing
Youth A hit Supervisor 2 on the bottom. Staff 4 stated Youth A told
her Supervisor 2 flicked water at her bottom in the kitchen. Staff 4
reported she went to administration to tell them and was informed
the situation was being investigated. Staff 4 stated she was not
working the day of the incident.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 6, 2023. Staff 5 described Supervisor 2 as a good
supervisor, fair, consistent and follows all the rules. Staff 5 denied
having any concerns with Supervisor 2’s interactions with any of
the youth. Staff 5 stated Youth A cross’s boundaries with
Supervisor 2 all the time by calling Supervisor 2 her favorite, tries
to talk with him during quiet time or when she has been redirected
by a different staff member. Staff 5 stated when this happens, she
has heard Supervisor 2 redirect Youth A or another staff member
will step in to redirect Youth A. Staff 5 reported Supervisor 2
holds Youth A accountable just like any other youth. Staff 5 stated
she did not see the water flicking incident, see Youth A hit
Supervisor 2 on the bottom, or ever hear Supervisor 2 tell a youth
they were attractive, beautiful, or cute.
Staff 6 was interviewed via telephone on September 7, 2023.
Staff 6 stated she primarily works third shift but has on occasion
picked up shifts during the day, so she has worked with
Supervisor 2. Staff 6 reported when Supervisor 2 was first hired
he was always cautious on being alone with the youth and always
on point. Staff 6 stated she feels Supervisor 2 has become more
comfortable with the youth and needs to be aware that what he
says can be taken the wrong way by some of the youth in the
home. Staff 6 reported she has heard Youth A make sexual
comments towards Supervisor 2 and Supervisor 2 correct Youth
6

A. Staff 6 described hearing Supervisor 2 talk about his home life
and his girlfriend with the youth in the house and Youth A turned
the conversation into something sexual. Staff 6 reported she
corrected Youth A and Supervisor 2 walked out of the room. Staff
6 denied ever hearing Supervisor 2 tell any youth they were
attractive, beautiful, or cute. Staff 6 stated she heard about the
water incident but does not recall seeing anything take place in
the kitchen with Supervisor 2 and Youth A.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of August 27,2023, from the kitchen was
reviewed on September 1, 2023. The video does not have
sound. Supervisor 2 is washing a sharp knife in the kitchen sink
while Youth A is standing at the stove cooking. Supervisor 2
finishes washing the knife, shakes his right hand over the sink
while holding the knife in his left hand, turns from the sink, takes
one step, and shakes his hand again. When he shakes his hand,
he is walking past Youth A, who is still at the stove cooking with
her back to Supervisor 2. Video shows Supervisor 2 take another
step and then is out of view on the camera. It was reported by
Supervisor 2 he walked to the locked closet to put the sharp knife
away. Youth A is seen in the video wiping the back of her left leg,
below her bottom and above the back of her knee. Staff 6 is seen
walking through the kitchen. Supervisor 2 does not appear to say
anything as his lips do not move. Youth A’s face is not seen on
the camera.
Documents Reviewed:
• Supervisor 2’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary
record regarding interactions with youth.
• Case note dated August 21, 2023 which was consistent
with Staff 1 and Staff 4’s interviews.
• Standards of Conduct Policy 6.0 states staff are always
expected to maintain ethical and professional behavior.
“This includes the expectation that staff are to interact with
youth in a manner promoting their emotional and physical
safety while incorporating trauma responsive practices.”
Analysis The facility is found in compliance. Supervisor 2 did use the word
attractive when telling Youth A she was young, smart, attractive
and encouraging her to get out in the real world and make
something of yourself but was not used in an inappropriate
context. Video confirms Supervisor 2 flicked water onto Youth A
but it appears it was unintended and as Supervisor 2 was walking
to lock up the sharp knife.
7

CONSULTATION:
It was recommended a conversation occur with Supervisor 2 on
better understanding the youth that he is working with and how
interactions can be perceived by youth and staff members.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
